info.name: ASTUDIO Recruitment Task
info.description:
## Steps to our APIs:

1. Ensure you have imported both, the collection and its local environment vars. Make sure the environment is selected.
    
2. Login with the following credentials: (You'd better save it into your env vars)  
    `username`: `minaalfy8@gmail.com`  
    `password`: `newPassw&rd1`
    
3. Store the `access_token` you've just obtained into the environment variable `{{accessToken}}`. Or navigate to `Collection > Authorization tab > Use the access_token as your Beare Token`.
    
4. You can now perform `Projects/Timesheets`; as all requests in this Postman collection inherit their parent Authorization, i.e. the token you have just stored.
    
5. When done, revoke your access token. (Logout)
    

---

### Kindly note that all listing endpoints support pagination. Thus, request can have a

- `page` \~ Current page. (default: 1)
    
- `per_page` \~ Results count per page. (default: 10, max: 100)

item.name: Passport Tokens
item.description:
Generate an access token. You must have the `client-id` and `client-secret`.

Currently, authentication is supported using `username` and `password`.

item.name: Attributes
Attribute options

request.description:
List all projects:

- sorted descendingly by `id`.
    
- supports filtration by `name`, `status`, `department` name, `start_date`, and `end_date`. No need to use the full value for the needed projects, just a part of it.

response.name: Fetch project departments (options)

item.description:
Project endpoints. (full CRUD)

You must be logged-in to have access all project endpoints.

item.name: Timesheets logs/records

query.description: Filter by project id. (numeric ~ exact id)
Filter by user id. (numeric ~ exact id). Disabled for regular users.
Filter by task date. (date ~ entered by the user)

request.description:
List all projects:

- sorted descendingly by `id`.
    
- supports filtration by `project_id`, `user_id`,`task_name, hours`, `date`, and `created_at`. No need to use the full value for the needed projects, just a part of it.
    
- Currently, for regular users, results are forcibly filtered by his/her `id`. (numeric \~ exact id)  
    Later on, it is supposed that admins would be able to filter the results by user/assignee id.

response.name: Filter logs by project, date, and name

query.description: Filter by project id. (numeric ~ exact id)
Filter by user id. (numeric ~ exact id). Disabled for regular users.
Filter by task date. (date ~ entered by the user)

request.description:
Update an existing timehseet log **of yours.**

Unfortunately, you cannot change the `project_id`. To do so, just delete the unneeded log and re-create a new one on the right project using the [create endpoint](https://go.postman.co/workspace/549948de-ec54-4a7f-8aec-92fcc75914b3/documentation/40194412-577d4adf-ad5d-4b50-809f-3f986018c24f?entity=request-f0bc5c3c-305e-45eb-b43a-b582738a3e5c).

formdata.value: Some description about what has been done in this task..

formdata.description: * Project id the task is logged to. (numeric)
